meanings.definition: Willing to do what one is told or ordered to do.
meanings.sent1: The dog was biddably following its owner's commands.
meanings.sent2: She is a biddably student who always listens to her teacher.
meanings.sent3: The robot behaved biddably, never questioning its programming.
meanings.sent4: The leaves on the tree swayed biddably in the gentle breeze.
meanings.sent5: The soldier's biddably attitude made him a valuable member of the team.

meanings.definition: In a manner that is obedient or compliant to commands or requests.
meanings.sent1: The child followed the rules biddably during the game.
meanings.sent2: She nodded biddably when asked if she understood the instructions.
meanings.sent3: The cat meowed biddably as if agreeing to the plan.
meanings.sent4: The wind blew biddably, carrying the scent of flowers through the air.
meanings.sent5: The students lined up biddably for the school assembly.
